favourite.article: Keith Green sang this.. Beautiful.
These are close to the lyrics I'm familiar with but the tune is nothing like I remember. Do you have another version?
I love this song, and I like this version of psalms. PSALMS 51:10-12 Thank You LORD.
I love this song. It really motivates me.
Indeed God.
That's nice.

Wow! Oh Lord Jesus this really inspires me and I hope it does to you too because I know I am a sinful person and I do mistakes and I'm not perfect but I love this song because I feel renewed and I feel clean and it's hard to stay away from the world (school) but we have to be the light and shine. Thank You Lord that You cannot cast me away from Thy presence. I want to be filled with Your joy. I want to be happy. Thank You Lord. O Lord Jesus I love You. I am so happy to be seeing all these comments and all over the world people enjoying The Lord. ðŸ˜Œ

First listened to this hymn from one of my friend's mobile. I felt so touched in my heart that I decided to sing in our church and I started to search the lyric on Google. Really the song is touching in my heart.
I feel am new and feel the presence of God in me. Amen.
I sing this song to myself when I'm struggling with a bad attitude. It helps restore my peace!
I like this version of the psalm. Could you please tell me if the tune is subject to copyright and how I can get permission to use it? Thanks and God Bless.

I first listen to this hymn from one of our choir members in my local church, I felt so touched in my spirit that I kept singing the song all through that Sunday that I almost lost appetite for food. And it baffles me up till now that whenever I remember and sing the song or someone sing it around me, I can not but see tears flowing down my eyes, especially when it reaches the lines "Restore unto me the joy of Thy salvation; And renew a right spirit within me".
Ephesians 2:8-9 King James Version (KJV) 8 For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God: 9 Not of works, lest any man should boast.

Matthew 6:14-15 King James Version (KJV) 14 For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you: 15 But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
Romans 15:13 King James Version (KJV) 13 Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.
Psalm 51, the reason why it was written. For the director of music. A psalm of David. When the prophet Nathan came to him after David had committed adultery with Bathsheba.

Psalm 51:10-12 King James Version (KJV) 10 Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me. 11 Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me. 12 Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit. This is from the Book Of Psalms in the Bible
I like this song and I used to sing it because it gives hope and joy for the glory of God.

Restore unto the joy of salvation oh my Lord. I feel so light anytime I listen to this song. I feel burdens being lifted and I feel God restoring me. Thank You Jesus for Your Holy Spirit. I can feel the tears flowing.

I really love this song - I felt so touched by the Spirit of God and bring tears to my eyes-that's how wonderful it is-I can worship the Lord with only this song the whole day. Thank you and may God bless you by writing more songs that can change peoples' lives and that can uplift peoples' spirit.

Thank You Lord for shining on me that I have left my first love for You and letting me know my rebellious nature. Thank You for causing me to draw near to You again. This will be my prayer all these days. Amen.

O, how much our heart needs to be healed. It's "sticky" to so many things...Lord, Beloved Lord, Healer of our heart, create in us a new heart, a pure heart, a God-loving heart, single, proper. May we come to You "several times a day" to deal with our heart. "Give me your heart..." Yes Lord, we give You our heart.
Fifty some years ago our youth choir sang this Psalm, different tune, but oh what prayerful words. May everyone who hears it seek Him and allow the creation of a clean heart in their lives.
Blessed are the pure in heart for they shall see God. Lord today make me pure in heart that I may see You moment by moment. Amen! Lord, I still love You!!!
I love you Jesus I realy do. Thank You for Your love and faithfulness. Create in me a clean heart and spirit. Wash me, clean and restore me. God I desire only to serve You. Please Lord forgive me.

I cannot sing this with out tears. The closer I get to the Lord and the closer I get to going home (I am 70) I realise that we fall so short of the mark. Be ye Holy for I am holy. It is not enough to be good compared to some. He never said be good. This song is my prayer.
My prayer, every hour of every day.
I would like to remember to pray this each morning. God is so good to lead us and clean us when we remember to ask.
Amen!

I sing this song every day. The words go straight from my heart to the Lord, it is my most heartfelt prayer. I know He hears me because every day my soul is full of forgiveness and sweetness. Praise God! Never doubt that He lives! He loves you and is just waiting for you to love Him back.

This song is precious right here and sweet. This song was highly used by the Lord to break through my heart. I can almost feel my heart hatching all over like when a baby chick when it hatches from the warmth of the parent.

Our heart by nature is one that opposes God; it's utterly corrupt. Its desires pulls us away from God and from pursuing the things of God. I pray the Lord give me a new heart -- a heart to love Him, to honor Him, to please Him in all things and through all things. Lord Jesus! Restore in me the joy of my salvation!!!
Amen!! May the Lord continue to work Himself within us that we may have a clean heart toward Him.
Create in me a clean heart oh God! Cast me not away from Thy presence.
I cry when I sing or hear this song.. It reminds me that I can't do anything alone, no matter what. God work in our hearts and make us clean. I am nothing without You. Amen.
Create me a clean heart O God and renew a right spirit within me. Praise the Lord!!
Beautiful song.It shows how the Lord loves us and forgives us even from our utter depravity. Let us ask the Lord as David did to create in us a clean heart and renew the right spirit.

To the writer of this song, THANK YOU! I love this song and I love the Scripture [Psalms 51] Because the HEART is where God lives, the HEART is how God touches us, the HEART is how God loves through us, and with our HEARTS God expects us to love and touch others. Because what comes from the HEART reaches the HEART... When God lives in us, others will certainly be able to tell... So each and Everyday we muct ask God to CREATE IN US A CLEAN HEART AND RENEW HIS LOVING SPIRIT WITHIN US... PRAISE GOD!!!
I like this because I want to have a clean and faithful heart toward God.

King David had a desire for God's heart, which is His building. Yet the Lord let him fell to the deepest pit in David's life, and now, David fully realizing his situation, with all that Jehovah had done for him in view, cried out to God, and had the deepest, and most absolute repentance. His transgression and repentance with the forgiveness of the God issued in a marriage, which brought forth Solomon, the peaceful one, the beloved, who is the builder of the temple of God. In our Christian life, we will have experience like David, where we fall and think how can I have done this. Then we will have the most genuine repentance, our natural man will be dealt with, and we will never boast because we know our source is like Solomon. The builders of the Temple of God must have this kind of experience. So saints, never be discouraged. Come, boldly to the throne of grace.

Sometimes I feel like I am all wrong with the Lord. This hymn reminds me that we have to ask the Lord to do the work in us and stop relying on ourselves. Whenever we do this the Lord will take us back as a loving Father. Hallelujah!

This song reminds me to remember the joy that I had when I was first saved. "Restore unto me the joy of Thy salvation." This line is so precious to me. Many times we're busy and forget to turn to the Lord, but we can always consecrate ourselves that we would have a clean heart only for Him.
It touches the central part of our being where the Lord is making His home.

I like this song because it reminds me to pray to the Lord that He will make my heart single and pure to Him, not looking on anything else. Sometimes our heart is occupied with so many things. May we pray to Him that He will clean our heart so that He can move freely within us. Amen.

This song always brings me back to the Lord even when I've been so far away. How precious is a consecration to the Lord? This is one of the biggest things in the universe. Praise the Lord that we can even know Him as a Person. My prayer would be that the Lord would continually and daily create a clean heart and renew my spirit and never leave me. Amen.

I like this song because it reminds me of my consecration to the Lord and it's really refresh me to go the Lord again and again and ask the Lord that He grant me again a heart that is pure and clean. Amen. O Lord Jesus.
I want my heart to be very pure for God.
Restore unto me the joy of my salvation, my dear Jesus! AMEN, LORD!
We need to have a clean heart and a right spirit within us. If we don't we will not have the joy of His salvation. Amen!!!!
I like this song because this was one of the songs that reminds me of my consecration to the Lord..and reminds me to pray more.." LORD CREATE IN ME A CLEAN HEART".
This song reminds me that God loves and requires the heart of every believer.

This song reminds me how I need to be renewed day by day. Every time I sing this song, I offered it as a prayer so that the Lord will cleanse, renew and restore my whole being; to be fully captured by Him.
I like this song...reminds me not to love the worldly things and always keep the presence of the Lord. OH LORD JESUS ALWAYS CLEAN MY SPIRIT...Amen.
Amen! Renew and restore my spirit unto Thy salvation!
I LOVE this song! It's always touched me so much in my heart. This song was related to a story in the bible of David. He had committed a sin, while he was a king. He wrote his song for forgiveness.

I Love this sweet and tender song. My favorite song that I love to sing to the Lord in the morning. We all need a new heart and a right spirit to contact the Lord in the morning. Praise the Lord for His unlimited Mercy. "Touch the Throne of Grace!!
Amen! Not only do we need concentrate Him, we need to be renewed in our mind.
Everybody should make this song his prayer. We are in such in a degraded worldly generation that we need the lord to "create in us a clean heart." Praise the Lord for David's prayer!
I like this song because I need to have a clean heart for the Lord's economy. This is my prayer!!
It encourages me to turn away from the world.
